<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><Highlight kind="normal">      Filename, MapSize, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a05f5b9a11bdcc5feba62899f95dcf878a3134224cba2545bc57954d3b072aebb4">Offset</a>, </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">/&#42;IsText=&#42;/</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">false</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">,</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="306"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="307"><Highlight kind="normal">std::unique&#95;ptr&lt;WritableMemoryBuffer&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00308" /><CodeLine lineNumber="308" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer/#a4cb6ea02c3dec9abe04c03e501c60f75"><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/writablememorybuffer/#a4cb6ea02c3dec9abe04c03e501c60f75">WritableMemoryBuffer::getNewUninitMemBuffer</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine">Twine</a> &amp;BufferName,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><Highlight kind="normal">                                            std::optional&lt;Align&gt; Alignment) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">MemBuffer = MemoryBufferMem&lt;WritableMemoryBuffer&gt;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Use 16-byte alignment if no alignment is specified.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> BufAlign = Alignment.value&#95;or(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(16));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Allocate space for the MemoryBuffer, the data and the name. It is important</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// that MemoryBuffer and data are aligned so PointerIntPair works with them.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallstring">SmallString&lt;256&gt;</a> NameBuf;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> NameRef = BufferName.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/twine/#ac521760e9a45f304a4cbe46ed4fff845">toStringRef</a>(NameBuf);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> StringLen = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(MemBuffer) + </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) + NameRef.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref/#a5db9240c74644c67759dd0f901fc3c7d">size</a>() + 1;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> RealLen = StringLen + <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a> + 1 + BufAlign.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align/#a80735739b49cf97a491922c8f9af2cc1">value</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (RealLen &lt;= <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>) </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Check for rollover.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// We use a call to malloc() rather than a call to a non-throwing operator</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// new() because LLVM unconditionally installs an out of memory new handler</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// when exceptions are disabled. This new handler intentionally crashes to</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// aid with debugging, but that makes non-throwing new calls unhelpful.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// See MemoryBufferMem::operator delete() for the paired call to free(), and</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// llvm::install&#95;out&#95;of&#95;memory&#95;new&#95;handler() for the installation of the</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// custom new handler.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;Mem = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(std::malloc(RealLen));</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00333" /><CodeLine lineNumber="333"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!Mem)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00334" /><CodeLine lineNumber="334"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00335" /><CodeLine lineNumber="335"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00336" /><CodeLine lineNumber="336"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The name is stored after the class itself.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"><Highlight kind="normal">  &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &#42;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">&gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(Mem + </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(MemBuffer)) = NameRef.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref/#a5db9240c74644c67759dd0f901fc3c7d">size</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00338" /><CodeLine lineNumber="338"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="#a9886e033885181e8d14e3fddce06af8c">CopyStringRef</a>(Mem + </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(MemBuffer) + </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">sizeof</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">), NameRef);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00339" /><CodeLine lineNumber="339"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00340" /><CodeLine lineNumber="340"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The buffer begins after the name and must be aligned.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00487" /><CodeLine lineNumber="487"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// If this not a file or a block device (e.g. it&#39;s a named pipe</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
